Body: This is where we can see Biometrids use according to them. .......-nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn------------- USE CASE 1 One of the greatest use cases for Biometrids’ platform is that people can make sure that the person they are dealing with is who they say they are. This brings a completely new world of opportunities to the world of identification. Imagine that a dealer on eBay has to identify themselves to you before you transfer your money. You will be 99.9% sure that the person will not scam you, and if they do and get a bad rating, no one will ever deal with them on that ID again. The same with emails, if you have to identify yourself to send an email, would you ever send scam mails? USE CASE 2 Another example is solving the identity problem for car rentals on the blockchain. We know that a rental service needs to identify their customers to make sure they get their car back. That is why a customer must pick up the car during opening hours at the car rental service. With Biometrids, you can pick up the car anytime. Scan your face, let the company have the papers they need, and off you go. Combined with slock.it locking solutions based on IoT (Internet of Things) this could be a fundamental change in rental services 19 . USE CASE 3 When a carrier delivers a package to a person, that person needs to show their ID when accepting the delivery. Using Biometrids, you just need the same ID that bought the packages in order to pick up the packages, and then you are always sure that the person is in the ecosystem of Biometrids’ platform. USE CASE 4 We see more and more ICO platforms come to life. In order to secure people from scam ICOs, these platforms could adopt Biometrids and have founders, developers, and every other team member and advisor identify themselves through the platform. That would increase the security to these platforms, when they are ready to run ICOs. The need and incentive behind these use cases can be found in a 2017 report from ID2020 stating that the financial exclusion resulting from the lack of proper identity has created a shadow economy estimated to be approximately $10 trillion a year, worldwide. I do understand that development comes in hand with macro factors that the team can't accelerate, but there has to be something to encourage participation.

Title: [ANN][ICO] Biometrids - ICO 19th of february - Decentralised and Anonymous ID
Body: It's really not about controlling people and personality. It's about verifying identity so you can have trusted relationships with people. That's at least one of its many use cases.  In a small perspective, let's put this forum as an example. Think about all the scams we would be able to avoid if developers would need to verify their identities before being able to announce their projects here. It would be in their best interest to not scam people with the project because the moment they try to do it, investors can give those people bad reputation, kinda like the reputation you can get here in the forum. The flaw with the forum's reputation is that it's linked with your username/email so it only takes you to get another account to keep scamming people. The main difference with biometrids reputation is that it damages or benefits your unique identity worldwide. There's lot of scammy developers that release multiple coins, all of them pump and dump schemes, one after the other one, and people fall into this scams every time. This type of identification can filter out all these scam projects preventing the same people from doing repeated scams over and over again.  This type of identification is much needed especially in this digital era.

Body: Thank you!  we are not here to fool people into thinking we can change the world by tomorrow. Things will take time. We believe in this technology, and it will for sure play a big part of the future. Both of blockchain and other aspects in life. We are not afraid of speaking about the pro and the cons. There are these things you should pass by to hack into the persons account on Biometrids platform. As the system is today.  1: You should know the person has an account. 2: You should have a 3D picture of the person. 3: You should have a 3D printer. 4: You should have the persons password. When it comes to getting another persons face in a 3D pucture it get much more complicated. Combine this with a password on top and its just like 2 factor authentication we know from websites today.  You can watch a video of the hack here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zA025AkNPY0 It took them 9 hours, to setup the mask before it unlocked the phone. Then add that you might not even know if the person has an account. You could waste a lot of time for nothing.

Author: Biometrids
Title: [ANN][ICO] Biometrids - ICO 19th of february - Decentralised and Anonymous ID
Body: The main problem of identifying people is that you will need some kind of checkpoint to do this. This could be government, facebook or some other 3rd party service. But that doesn't make the ID decentralised, because you need this "middleman".  By using your face, you can make the ID unique,(due to the uniqueness of your face.). This way you can make sure that people can't scam. We wlll also integrate a voting system to the platform. So if someone DO scam. Then every one can see, that this ID has been scamming. And since they cant make a new ID on the platform, unless they get a new face. Who wants to do scam? They will be excluded from the platform, because people know they might do another scam.  We will provide this to other services through our API, and in the later stages, we will implement nodes for fast identification. This means, that if you use a coin, with many confirmations. Stores dont have to worry about confirmations, if the person pay through the Biometrids ID. Then they can make sure, that the person is identified as a no scammer. The person can make payments in seconds, and with out waiting for confirmations, as long as it is through the Biometrids platform

Author: Biometrids
Title: [ANN][ICO] Biometrids - ICO 19th of february - Decentralised and Anonymous ID
Body: We will be using the hardware in the phones, to identify people when they login. So the hardware will set the limits. At the moment one of the main issues is, that you can take a picture of a person, and then login to the account (with some phones). We will avoid this, buy having 3d pictures. So people need to move around. Machinelearning, will help recognise the face when there is changes (wearing makeup, or you have a hat on etc.) And so on. It will use small references and skin to identify you. Be aware, that our first version, will NOT support all of these things from the start. But this is where we will build the platform.  When the developers of phones have a 100% secure way of using facial recognition, our goal is to keep the private key in the chain, with the face. And then you only need to use your face to login. No password to remember. (this is one the future things)  And yes, the face will be encrypted in the chain for ever. You cant delete the face again. Also you need a device, which supports facial recognition to use the platform. So its also a question of when the facial recognition is fully adopted.
